description:
Vincent Vega Plays Tarintino, A night of surf, soul and rockn'roll bangers from Quentin Tarantino's cult classic films, played with great vengeance & furious anger by Wellingtons favourite surf-rock saviours Vincent Vega. Expect tunes from Pulp Fiction, Reservoir Dogs, Once Upon A Time In Hollywood, The Hateful Eight, Death Proof and more.

Featuring special guests Lisa Tomlins on vocals and Louis TM on keys and vocals, as well as the usual suspects in Richard Te One (drums), Nick Lissette (bass) and Chris Armour (guitar)

Music from 9:30pm FREE ENTRY
label: Music & Concerts

description:
'TONES OF SILENCE' - FUTUNA CHAPEL IN B&W - EXHIBITION, ‘TONES of SILENCE’ – FUTUNA CHAPEL in BLACK & WHITE - EXHIBITION
The ‘Tones of Silence’ -explored through B & W photography taken with vintage camera and lenses to give another way of viewing and experiencing the Chapel. This exhibition will explore the tones, textures, composition and forms of the Chapel in black and white with many shades of grey.
"Generally, the older the equipment, the greater the personal input of the photographer is required and therefore the greater the commitment and individuality. Often, you can look at a 19th-century photograph and tell who the photographer is. You certainly can't do that today. It isn't only the camera and lens, but also the type of film (or in those days, glass plate), the developer used and how the print is made onto particular types of paper. Each gives a distinct interpretation".
John Grace - email - 18/06/25
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all koha received from the exhibition events will go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust.  Please register
BOOKINGS ARE PREFERRED TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
label: Arts & Theatre

description: Financial Foundations: Budgeting for New Business Owners, A practical workshop on financial management and budgeting for new business owners. Learn how to set up financial systems, use accounting software, and create a budget that ensures your business stays on a healthy financial track from the very beginning.
label: Business & Networking

description: Business Budgeting Workshop: Spreadsheets & Financial Tracking, A practical workshop on using spreadsheets for business budgeting and financial tracking. Learn how to create a simple budget, forecast revenue and expenses, and monitor your business's financial health with confidence.
label: Classes & Workshops

description: The Great Wairarapa Dog Show, A light-hearted dog show competition open to all breeds and ages, with categories including 'Best Trick', 'Waggiest Tail', and 'Cutest Costume'. A fun family event with prizes and local pet-focused stalls. This is a new take on a dog show and is located in the Wairarapa.
label: Community & Culture

description: Low-Carbon Economy: A Business Transition Seminar, A seminar on the role of businesses in transitioning to a low-carbon economy. Hear from business leaders on how to reduce your carbon footprint, invest in renewable energy, and create a business model that is both profitable and sustainable.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Community Hero Card Workshop: A Creative Gift, A workshop on creating personalized greeting cards for a local hero or community member. Kids will learn different craft techniques, from paper cutting to collage, to create a unique and heartfelt card for a local hero in their community.
label: Kids & Parents

description: Wellington Meditation Festival: A Wellness Event, A festival of wellness, with a focus on a specific practice, e.g., meditation. Explore a variety of meditation practices, from guided meditation to sound baths. This festival is for anyone who wants to learn about meditation and well-being.
label: Festivals

description: Fantasy Film Festival: 'Pan's Labyrinth', A screening of Guillermo del Toro's dark fantasy film 'Pan's Labyrinth' at the BATS Theatre. This magical and heartbreaking film is a must-see for fans of fantasy and art-house cinema. The screening will be followed by a Q&A with a local film critic.
label: Film & Media

description: Dessert Degustation, An evening of pure indulgence. Our pastry chef has created a multi-course dessert degustation, with each dish a work of art. From rich chocolate mousses to delicate fruit tarts and innovative ice creams, this is a sweet feast for the eyes and the palate. Wine and cocktail pairings are also available.
label: Food & Drink

description: Wellington's Cultural Policy Forum: A public meeting to discuss and provide feedback on the city's new cultural policy, including funding for arts organisations, community events, and public spaces.

description: Digital Transformation in Government: A presentation on the government's strategy for digitising public services, with a focus on improving accessibility and efficiency for citizens.

description: Men's Wellbeing Workshop: Responding to Change, A workshop for men to develop tools for navigating life changes, big and small. Topics include career transitions, relationship challenges, and new parenthood. The session is led by a male wellness coach and focuses on open discussion and practical strategies for a healthy mindset.

description: Wellington Writers Group: Short Story Workshop, Join the Wellington Writers Group for a special short story writing workshop. Our guest instructor, a published author, will guide you through the process of writing a short story, from brainstorming and outlining to revision and editing. This is a great opportunity to get some expert guidance on your writing project and connect with other writers. Limited spaces, so book early!.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description: Wellington Local Makers Fair, The Wellington Local Makers Fair is a vibrant showcase of handcrafted goods, bringing together a diverse group of artisans from across the city. You'll find unique items including custom jewelry, intricate pottery, and beautiful textiles. This event is a great way to meet the creators behind the products and support small businesses in your community. Enjoy a bustling atmosphere with live music and delicious food stalls while you shop.
label: Markets & Fairs

description: Intercultural Worship Service, A special worship service celebrating the diversity of our community. This event will feature music, prayers, and readings from a variety of cultural and linguistic traditions. It's a beautiful opportunity to experience the unity of the church in a rich tapestry of worship. Everyone is welcome to join in this celebration of faith.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Beginner's Kayaking Tour on the Wairarapa Coast: A guided kayaking tour of the Wairarapa Coast, perfect for beginners. Learn basic paddling techniques and enjoy the stunning views of the coastline from the water. All equipment is provided.
label: Sports & Fitness
